medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ pain that progressed to central epigastric pain radiating to back with nausea and vomiting, fevers, and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 days ago, starting as RUQ pain and worsening to central epigastric pain radiating to the back. The patient also experienced nausea, vomiting, fevers, and chills. No chest pain, shortness of breath, diarrhea, or abnormal bowel habits reported. No dysuria noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Known gallstones, chronic renal failure (B/L 1.9), GERD with Barrett's esophagus, CAD status post CABG x 5, rheumatoid arthritis, colitis of unknown origin, atherosclerosis. Previous surgeries include femur fractures (2), left foot surgery, and CABG x 5.
